articles.author: Elizabeth Weise
articles.title: COVID vaccine candidate from Pfizer must be stored at minus 112, prompting a rush on dry ice - USA TODAY
articles.description: At minus 112, exposed skin freezes almost instantly. It’s also the temperature required to store what’s expected to be the first COVID-19 vaccine.
articles.content:
Pfizer and BioNTech released early study results indicating that their vaccine prevented more than 90% of infections with the virus that causes COVID-19.
